column4: it says:      dpkg:  dependency problems prevent configuration of libdvdcss2
it says:      dpkg:  dependency problems prevent configuration of libdvdcss2
hmmm, rabeldable, i think i get it, i need to get libdvdcss2 before i get libdvdcss2-dev
hmmm, yeah, i got the wrong one i guess... haha, i really could have figured that out on my own i guess.  but thanks rabeldable
alright, ive got it all set up and installed, so now what?  rabeldable
you install those with 'sudo dpkg -i <package file>' from a console
then you're good to go
I thought it had better support for playing DVDs but yeah.
Or use totem
try /dev/dvd
totem to the rescue! :)
If you can figure out the right thing to tell vlc, it'll work.
well, im sure it will... hahaha, but i dont know what to tell it.
Use the GUI to build the path for you.
hmm, GUI?
right click on the file and choose open with and choose vlc (or open with vlc if that's there)
then all files of that type will open with vlc
thats what i do, but i was wondering if there was a way to have it associated so that i only have to double click the file instead of right clicking and choosing vlc
after choosing it once it should have become the default
no clue then
haha, okay
maybe there is something in system->preferences
